titleStmt.title: F. P. Stickly to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG1698

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Gov Thomas E. Bramlette
Frankfort Ky

Dr Sir I wish a commission as a "Notary Public" for the counties of Knox, Clay, Laurel, Whitley, and Harlan, I have been and am now engaged in the preparation & prosecution of a great many Pension & Bounts &c &c applications. very frequently I am caused a good deal of trouble in getting the proper office, to swear the parties and take proof before, as a Notary myself I could save the trouble complained of. There is not a Notary in this Knox County " and I think it doubtful whether there is one in any of the other Counties above named, for my loyalty, & businness qualifications, I would refer you to Genl John M. Harlan & Col James H Garrard of Frankfort.

I am very Respectfully
F. P. Stickly
Barbourville Ky
Oct 21 1863

Knox Co
N. P.
F. P. Stickley
Comd.
31st Oct 1863
